title: Shailene Woodley wishes Ben Volavola good luck ahead of Rugby World Cup
text:
Hollywood star Shailene Woodley, has wished her boyfriend good luck through an emotional Instagram post as he plays for Fiji at the Rugby World Cup.

Ben Volavola was rejected by the New South Wales Waratahs in 2015 and has since bounced around the globe playing rugby union in different countries.

He is in Japan with the Fiji team competing at this year's World Cup, and his 'Big Little Lies' star girlfriend Woodley wished him well in a social media post saying the rugby star will 'live in my heart forever'.

One of Hollywood's biggest A-listers, Shailene Woodley, has wished her boyfriend good luck through an emotional Instagram post ahead of the Rugby World Cup (pictured Woodley and Volavola)

Shailene (pictured) met Volavola two years ago when she was filming the blockbuster 'Adrift' in Fiji

'Sports held no significance to me before I met Ben,' she captioned a photo of the rugby star.

'Over the past few years, I have learned more from the discipline, the dedication, the levity, the sacredness, the mental skills, the intensity, and the character exemplified in this sport than I have through any other medium.'

The pair's romance blossomed after meeting in Fiji two years ago while Ms Woodley was filming the blockbuster 'Adrift'.

Volavola, 28, was born in Fiji but grew up in Sydney where he attended the prestigious Newington College.

'I couldn't feel more blessed to call these men my brothers, and to have one extra special one who will live in my heart forever,' Woodley wrote to Instagram (pictured)

'I ask all of you to send a little prayer and some good grounding energy to the Flying Fijians for this World Cup,' she wrote.

'I couldn’t feel more blessed to call these men my brothers, and to have one extra special one who will live in my heart forever as the first man to show me what TRUE unconditional support, love, grace, compassion, humor, comfort, and unadulterated joy looks like.'

Volavola's short stint with the NSW Waratahs came to an end in 2015 before he made his debut with the Flying Fijians

'Over the past few years, I have learned more from the discipline, the dedication, the levity, the sacredness, the mental skills, the intensity, and the character exemplified in this sport than I have through any other medium' Woodley wrote on Instagram

During his first season with the Waratahs, he played eight games but in the two seasons to follow, the young athlete didn't leave the bench.

Following his rejection from New South Wales, he was poached by the New Zealand Crusaders for the 2016 season before switching again to the Melbourne Rebels in 2017.

He also made his debut for the Flying Fijians in 2015 after changing his eligibility to his birth country of Fiji.

On Wednesday night, Fiji will take on Wales in the next round of the World Cup.
description: Ben Volavola's short stint with the New South Wales Waratahs came to and end in 2015, as he now looks to bring the Fijian team victory in the Rugby World Cup.
authors: Eliza Mcphee For Daily Mail Australia
